answerText: Prader-Willi syndrome[10] This phenomenon, in which one allele inherited from a parent is silenced, affects chromosome 15, explaining why Prader-Willi syndrome is so devastating. It shares its name with a phenomenon in which a bunch of baby birds followed Konrad Lorenz around.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 5 | 1 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This disease results in hands and feet remaining small in comparison to the rest of the body. For 10 points each: [10] Name this disease, caused by a deletion of several genes on chromosome 15, which results in constant hunger and incomplete sexual development.
